xml.desc: This method returns a big chunk of all attribute-related metadata known to OKAPI. Usually you will not want to use this method - the result might be big enough to make your mobile application slow. Consider using one of the other methods in this module.

returns.p: A dictionary of the following structure:

li.p: attributes - a dictionary. Attribute IDs are mapped to keys of this dictionary. Each value is a dictionary of the following structure:

ul.li: id - string, OKAPI's ID of the attribute (the same as the one in the key),

li.p: gs_equivs - a list of Groundspeak (geocaching.com) attributes, which have an exact (or very similar) meaning. Each attribute is described as a dictionary of the following structure:

ul.li: id - ID of the Groundspeak attribute,
inc - integer, either 1 or 0. See Geocaching.com's XSD for details on its meaning,
name - the name of the attribute (as it is included in Groundspeak's GPX files).

li.p: Note, that one Groundspeak ID may be present in many gs_equivs.
internal_ids - a list of internal attribute IDs which will be mapped to this attribute when encountered in local OC database.
Note, that one internal ID may be mapped to many OKAPI attributes.
primary_internal_id - the internal ID of the OC site's attribute which matches this OKAPI attribute best, or null if there is no matching local attribute.
This field shoud generally NOT be used, because it may not be sufficient to completely describe the OKAPI attribute. Use it only if your are forced to have a 1:1 mapping of local attributes.
names - a dictionary of all known names of the attribute, in various langauges (ISO 639-1 language code is used as dictionary key).
If you'd like to help with the translations, see here.
descriptions - a dictionary of all known descriptions of the attribute, in various langauges (ISO 639-1 language code is used as dictionary key).
If you'd like to help with the translations, see here.
